subject: Re: [junit] Generation of the Test Cases
msgSnippet: Basically, no. Even the commercial tools can only create simple tests that test the standard things, like passing in nulls. One of the big dogs in that arena
messageBody:
Basically, no. Even the commercial tools can only create simple tests
that test the standard things, like passing in nulls. One of the big
dogs in that arena is JTest, which while it is wonderful, is no
substitute for unit tests written by a live programmer. This is not
only the case today, but will be the case until someone figures out
how to analyse what a programmer was trying to do and then can
generate tests that will verify that. Don't hold your breath waiting
for such software. And I'd really like to see something that can
generate my tests ahead of time so that I can practice automated TDD.
Now, that'd get my attention!

Simon

On 6/17/05, meghnath <meghnath@...> wrote:
> Hi
>
> I am in the QA.We are planning to generate test cases using Junit.
> We have basic understanding of the Java.
> Is there any open source tool which will generate ther test cases
> automatically.
> I knew there are some commerical tools, which will generate the test
> cases.
> But is therer any open source ?
>
> Thanks
> Meghanath
